That must've been the source of that roar of indifference I heard earlier today.
I was tempted to ask: "so who cares, exactly?" but I wasn't in the mood to deal with nomoreacs whining because I'm not showing enough respect to apple engineers that spend so much of their time to make his life feel like it has some meaning.
That's typically how fashion brands work -- they try to create new trends all the time to sell more shit. Not all of it catches on, see old navy tech vests for example. Sometimes they do, like this monstrosity:
  https://www.fashionphile.com/p... [fashionphile.com] 
I mean what the hell would anybody do with a handbag with big holes in it? Comes from the manufacturer basically useless, yet they sell for $10k.
Apple is already hard at work on a more budget-friendly model.

Just ten days ago you told us that they'd suspended work on that effort. So which is it?
They have plenty in stock now that the US customers have returned theirs.
